page.title: 15THE NUCLEAR POWER STATION
page.content: The Druridge Bay beach has always been a refuge for birdlife and is regarded as a local beauty spot. However,there is a proposal which would shatter this tranquility, the building of a huge nuclear power station immediately by the dunes.When word escaped about this proposal a great number of people were extremely shocked,while a lesser number support this idea. The many opposers to the power station have staged many controversial protest marches and they have also sent petitions to Alan Beith (our local M.P)and parliament.Most of the protesters argue their case on the grounds of destruction of the enviroment,and possible dangers to the health of the local people.
